channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description:
Journalism has no memory.
Comes to Republican corruption.
@sixteenthknick me too. i like the team we have.
Key moments from the Trump-Putin press conference. https://t.co/9wqhXvLLq3
@PeterHimler @POTUS Good one. How about this one. https://t.co/9wqhXvLLq3
6 maps showing how Berkeley has changed in the last 10 years. https://t.co/4CtSseGP3S

Tucker Carlson is a Nazi. https://t.co/63zUbJGGKo
Would Tucker Carlson make a good President?
And Dems are weak and scared and losing us our country. https://t.co/6BpcVGQLiQ
BTW as a Mets fan it’s great to see Donovan Mitchell showing up for the Mets. #lgm

1/3 NPR this morning did the ultimate unforgivable "both sides" horse-race bs -- they labeled people who support Roe v Wade as extremists and wondered if such extremism will cause the Democrats to lose in November. Journalism will let the center go where ever the Repubs want to
2/3 put it. Now Roe is extreme, last month it was the settled law, according to all but one of the Supreme Court justices (publicly, privately they were ready to destroy it). The problem isn't Repubs, they're just taking what we're letting them have. The problem is journalism and
3/3 the Democratic Party, but even more broadly the problem is we don't put a stop to this and tell the Dems clearly that they have to get real, or we won't re-elect them.
Abortion laws spark profound changes in other medical care. https://t.co/N9F2uTbcmh
Michigan state Sen. Mallory McMorrow wants Democrats to “call bullshit, bullshit”. https://t.co/2yBg50bOOD
2010: Rebooting RSS, pulling it together. https://t.co/KxRw7uVDj7

I was taught that America is a great country. 1. By the education system, which was wrong. 2. By my family -- who had good cause to feel America is great, because they took us in during the war, if they hadn't my family would have died. But I'm beginning to lose the faith.
A country isn't great because it says it's great.
A great country does what the Bill of Rights says, but for every citizen, and not for fictitious citizens like corporations.
And the people who make the rules have to be great too, net-net. Not everyone is great, of course, but the checks and balances apply and the system is set up so that it lives up to the rules in the Bill of Rights.

NPR this morning did the ultimate unforgivable "both sides" horse-race-manship -- they labeled people who support Roe v Wade as extremists and wondered if such extremism will cause the Democrats to lose in November. The reporter and interviewer was a young black woman.
We have to increase the number of justices on the Supreme Court in January 2023. I want to hear Democratic candidates say that, specifically. Codifying Roe is not enough. I simply won't support any candidate that doesn't support reforming the court.
So imho -- wanting to get back to Roe is far from extreme. It isn't nearly extreme enough.
Texas government plays the role of god. https://t.co/bSVQT1ctul

@bloatedlesbian i don't think it's all that expensive, you have them put it up for a minute, once, and take a picture of it and put it on your instagram page. or maybe it isn't even real, maybe it's just photoshopped? i don't know who he is btw.
@bloatedlesbian how much do you think it costs?
English words of Yiddish origin. https://t.co/a4jyyBtUW2

I can't believe all the crazy bs swirling around the Knicks right now. Here's the deal. We have a really interesting team, we're going to get really emotionally involved with them next season. We're going to *love* rooting for them, win or lose. So stop kvetching and relax. ;-)
A quote from the Internet History podcast sums up pretty concisely what non-technical people should know to understand why podcasting is so special. https://t.co/LXXZqvafZa
I was looking through some archives and came across this picture of Bill Gates and Steve Jobs probably taken in the 80s or early 90s. A lot of time has passed. https://t.co/TwGOTtf0Vw
Lake Mead, once the largest water reservoir in the US, now little more than a graveyard. https://t.co/IJZZeyqTR7
How William Olson, Right-Wing Lawyer, Pitched Trump on a 2020 Election Plot. https://t.co/c8zcYVdJ5g
"Looking for a job when you’re in your 50s is sobering. 'People don’t want to see their moms in the office,' one friend told me." https://t.co/wNf9r0OTnr

1/2 I want Biden to step back after the election and let the Democrats have a great primary campaign where we really discuss, as a country, what our options are going forward. Not limited to things considered too daring, like expanding the court.
2/2 It's clear Biden will not do what we need. But that's okay, his greatest contribution would be to create a stage for the next generation of leaders to work things out, along with Bernie Sanders and others.
